text: [Music]
in this video you will learn how to
create a resale authorization for your
channel Partners so they can resell your
AWS Marketplace product to their
customers the partner CRM connector
integrates AWS Marketplace and APN
directly into your Salesforce
environment this seamless integration
empowers your sales team to efficiently
co-sell and sell with a
WS for resellers it significantly
simplifies the management of resale
authorizations streamlining your AWS
partnership
processes before you can create a resale
authorization your Salesforce account
must be configured with the AWS
Marketplace module of the partner CRM
connector you can find resources to
configure the connector at the end of
this
video here's how my Salesforce console
looks after configuring the
connector now I will walk you through
the process of creating a new resale
authorization from the resale
authorization section of the console I
will choose new next choose the product
you want to create a resale
authorization
for you can allow the channel partner to
extend an offer to a specific customer
or any of their customers by not
specifying a customer ID you can allow
the channel partner to extend an offer
to any
customer enter a meaningful name for
your resale
authorization and an appropriate
description next you need to specify the
AWS account ID the channel partner will
use for extending a private offer to
their
customers under the contract duration
you can choose
standard SAS opportunity type this
allows the channel partner to extend all
contract durations associated with the
product as part of the private
offer next you can choose product
dimensions and corresponding
rates for this demo I chose the band GPS
product Dimension with monthly rate as
one the rate for a one-year term as
10 the rate for a 2-year term as
18 and 28 as the rate for a three-year
term I specified a rate for a usage
Dimension as
well next you need to choose the terms
and conditions for the resale
authorization that the customer must
agree to you can either associate your
own terms and conditions or the standard
contract for AWS
Marketplace for this demo I chose the
standard contract de developed by AWS
Marketplace here is a quick sneak peek
of the standard contract for AWS
Marketplace optionally you can specify
terms and conditions that the channel
partner must accept before they can
create a channel partner private offer I
chose the standard reseller contract
developed by AWS
Marketplace here is a quick sneak peek
of the reseller contract for AWS
Marketplace
next you can specify whether the channel
partner can create a single or multiple
private offers from the resale
authorization if you want to allow the
channel partner to extend multiple
private offers only until a certain date
you can set the expiration date for the
resale
authorization I chose to allow the
channel partner to create private offers
until October 31st
2025 next you can specify the latest
possible start date for the contract
between the customer and the channel
partner I chose the 1st of March
2025 since this is not a renewal I will
leave this section as it
is I will now create a resale
authorization for the channel
partner my resale authorization has been
published when the channel partner
navigates to their Salesforce crm's
shared resale authorization section they
will now see a resale authorization from
you as the
seller
congratulations you just learn how to
create an AWS Marketplace resale
authorization for a channel partner
using the AWS partner CRM connector
check out these resources to learn how
to configure and use the partner CRM
connector thanks for watching
